comments.text:
User-Agent:       
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110119 Firefox/4.0b10pre

A selection containing a button seems to prevent proper scrolling.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open testcase
2. click and hold mouse right before "AA"
3. hold button, drag into "Test" block, release button
4. left click at scrollbar and drag down
Actual Results:  
Page scrolls one line then scroll-bar and selection is "ripped off".

Expected Results:  
Do not ripp off elements from the page.

Also happens in 3.5.16 but not in 3.0.19.
comments.raw_text:

comments.text: For builds that old, you can't really get the changset easily.  :(  The best you can do is look at pushlog by date with a few hours of safety margin on both ends.

comments.text:
In local build(ubuntu10.06),
build from 6c375de7aaf7: fails
build from ab3c77a02ed0: fails
build from c9bc394e507a: works

So, I guess the following cset causes this.
ab3c77a02ed0	Neil Deakin — Bug 356295. Implement HTML5 drag-drop. r=smaug,neil,sr=roc

comments.text:
Created attachment 506057
patch

Just Removing support for the preventDrag flag and just assuming it is always true fixes this, but I want to test this a bit more. I need to think a bit about whether there are situations where we want this flag.
comments.creator: enndeakin@gmail.com
comments.author: enndeakin@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Just Removing support for the preventDrag flag and just assuming it is always true fixes this, but I want to test this a bit more. I need to think a bit about whether there are situations where we want this flag.

Hello there,

My friend and I are interested in helping out.  Is this bug still active?  If so, where/how do we begin?

Thanks.
comments.author: hmochoa@csupomona.edu
comments.creator: hmochoa@csupomona.edu
comments.text:
Hello there,

My friend and I are interested in helping out.  Is this bug still active?  If so, where/how do we begin?

Thanks.

Hi, the bug likely still exists. The patch is too old and would need updating. If I recall though, I wasn't sure whether the patch worked 100% correctly and it's too long ago for me to remember why. You're welcome to help out though if you can update the patch.

comments.text:
(In reply to Neil Deakin from comment #11)
> Hi, the bug likely still exists.

Yes, it does.

> The patch is too old and would need updating.

Very likely. Unfortunately I did not test your patch until a few minutes ago (I used an old Firefox 12 codebase to apply it). Interstingly it fixes also the "moving grey bar" of Bug 638409, because it seems to prevents draging of selected items: You can drag images and links, but not selected text.
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Neil Deakin from comment #11)

> The patch is too old and would need updating.
